DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to establish the relationship between moon and births through two analytic models.
DOC.brief_title: Models for Evaluate the Proximity of the Moon on the Frequency of Births
DOC.detailed_description: Retrospective, descriptive and observational study. Classical model performs comparisons of births among lunar periods, lineal, cubical and exponential estimation was performed in the SPSS software and the inflection point of the curve was estimated using the formula x=[In (1/ebx)]/ebx in the Geogebra model. The significance was establish by a p value of â‰¤ 0.05 (95% IC). The second analysis was performed by the difference of media between all the stages of the moon cycle as in another trials. The difference was establish by the T-student test. The difference between groups was performed by the one way ANOVA test. This study had the review and approval from the Ethics Committee of the institution and according with Mexican regulation, and in adherence to the Helsinki declaration and International Conference for Harmonisation
DOC.criteria: Pregnant women from January 2009 until June 2013 Pregnant women from any other period of time
